instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Not charging
threads.message: It didn't work before and I've replaced <CHIP>ISL95530</CHIP> with one I've ordered on AliExpress. It works nog, but it won't charge the battery. Afterwards I saw the videos where Louis explains about these chips not working. So would this need a proper <CHIP>ISL95530</CHIP> replacement or could there be other things that I'm missing?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Not charging
threads.message:
So machine works now, only battery not charging?
I was supposing this chip has firmware and expected a new one nor even generates <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Not charging
threads.message: Yes, the machine is fine otherwise. Anyway, the way to go is get one from a donor board?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Not charging
threads.message:
I suppose it has firmware and the best way to confirm that is replace it with donor.

However, as the machine works, apart of battery charging, measure something on the battery bus first.
Check voltage and resistance to ground on SCL/SDA lines.
Any history fault available?
Can you try a known good battery, or test its own on other machine?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Not charging
threads.message: Yes ISL on these has to come from a donor. New chips are all BS and don?t have firmware

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - Not charging
threads.message: Hmmm, customer wasn't patient enough for this. Board returned. Thanks for your help anyway.
